sentences: Bridget Kelly (born April 8, 1986) is an American singer and songwriter from New York City.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2008, Kelly, a pop and R&B recording artist, who has written songs for fellow American singers such as Kelly Clarkson, secured a recording contract with American rapper and hip-hop mogul Jay-Z's record label Roc Nation.
section: N/A

== Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Bridget Kelly, who is of a biracial background of Bahamian and Irish descent, was born on April 8, 1986, in New York City.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She is a graduate of Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School of Music & Art and Performing Arts in Manhattan.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2008, she signed a record deal with Jay-Z's Roc Nation.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Kelly has regularly filled in for Alicia Keys, when performing the song "Empire State of Mind" with Jay-Z, including performances on the Friday Night with Jonathan Ross, as well as Later...with Jools Holland show, the Coldplay, Viva la Vida tour, and the 9/11 memorial service.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Kelly also performed with Jay Z during a performance at the MTV Europe Music Awards 2009.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She performed "Empire State of Mind" at Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival as well as Bonnaroo Music Festival in summer 2010, with Jay-Z. Kelly also performed "Empire State of Mind" with Jay-Z on Saturday Night Live on May 8, 2010, as well as Rock am Ring on June 4 and T in the Park on June 12, 2010.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She subsequently performed with Jay-Z during "Empire State of Mind" at Peace & Love in Borlänge, Sweden.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Also at Summer Sonic 2010 in Chiba, Japan in August 2010 at Chiba Marine Stadium.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Also at Yankee Stadium, September 13, 2010.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Kelly made her first magazine cover appearance in the September 2010 issue of Honey Magazine.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In the interview to go along with the cover shoot, she describes her music as a fusion of R&B, soul and rock with influences coming from Alicia Keys, Alanis Morissette and Pink.
section: == Biography == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Every Girl and Cut to...
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Bridget Kelly ===
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: In early 2011, Kelly and her production team had approached Frank Ocean to write a song for her debut studio album.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: The song in question eventually became "Thinking Bout Forever", which Kelly commented; "it's sort of a vulnerable track
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: and I wanted everyone to feel me on it."
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: In July 2011, Roc Nation stated on the official site that Kelly is closing her album up and the first single would be the Frank Ocean-penned "Thinking Bout Forever".
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: On July 28, 2011, Ocean leaked his demo version of the song onto his tumblr account, with the title reading "Thinking Bout You".
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: The song was then promptly taken down by Ocean.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Kelly has worked with high-profile producers such as The-Dream, Ne-Yo, Jerry Wonda, James Fauntleroy II, Ryan Leslie, and Shea Taylor for her debut studio album.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Prior to the album's release, Kelly released her first extended play (EP), titled Every Girl, on October 19, 2011.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Kelly's version of "Thinkin Bout You" found its way onto the EP.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Kelly was ultimately fine with Ocean's decision, however she noted that she didn't like how most people thought Ocean's version was the original, and how people assumed her version was a cover version.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: About the confusion of the track, Kelly stated: "Now that push has come to shove, we're going to let the song have a life of its own.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: I think it's an amazing, well-written record.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Frank Ocean is incredibly talented, I will never say anything against that.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: But at the same time, you know, he's going to do what he wants to do, he's an artist as well.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: "In August 2012, her debut single "Special Delivery", was released to Urban radio stations.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Her second single
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: "Street Dreamin", features American rapper Kendrick Lamar and was released on May 21, 2013.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: Both songs were Top 40 hits on the Mediabase Urban Airplay charts.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: On November 26, 2013, Kelly announced she would be releasing her second EP and revealed her debut album was pushed back to a 2014 release.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: The EP includes six tracks as well as contributions from Jerry Wonda ("Goosebumps"), Pop Wansel, Sam Dew, Elijah Blake, and Cri$tyle.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: "I speak a lot about love and my feelings on these songs," said Bridget of the follow-up to her 2011 EP Every Girl.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: "I speak to those who have been in relationships, the good and the bad, and that in the midst of turmoil, finding something you can smile about."
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===

sentences: The EP, titled Cut to... Bridget Kelly, includes her debut single "Special Delivery" and was made available as a free download on December 17, via her official website.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Every Girl and Cut to... Bridget Kelly ===
== Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: 2014–present:
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: In June 2014, Kelly confirmed her split after six years with Roc Nation and she is about releasing her album independently.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: After the split, Kelly released two singles, "I Won't Cry" and "Almost More", which are the exclusive previews of her upcoming music.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: She is working with Jerry Wonda on the new album and changed the album title from Something Different to All or Nothing, which is set to release in 2017.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: She appeared on Love and Hip Hop: Hollywood from 2017 to 2018 as a supporting cast member for two seasons.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: In October 2020, Kelly began hosting the See, The Thing Is Podcast on the Joe Budden Network alongside cohosts Mandii B and Olivia Dope.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===

sentences: The podcast now only stars Bridget Kelly and Mandii B after Olivia Dope claimed Joe Budden sexually harassed her during taping, forcing her to quit her position on the show.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Parting Ways with Roc Nation and All or Nothing ===
